alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 11:50AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, eastern, and western Massachusetts, including the following counties, in central Massachusetts, Worcester. In eastern Massachusetts, Middlesex. In western Massachusetts, Franklin, Hampden and Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1149 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Worcester, Leominster, Fitchburg, Marlborough, Shrewsbury, Milford, Orange, Westford, Acton, Gardner, Hudson, Westborough, Grafton, Holden, Webster, Southbridge, Auburn, Northbridge, Hopkinton and Belchertown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
